text: Let’s keep talking then! Just as an FYI, I am a HubSpot lead and developer of the Workflows FE team and this was my ask of the greater community to get feedback on a potential new feature. We’re always on the lookout for ways to solve problems for our customers and given the “learn how to use the Workflows tool” issue has been around for years, we were looking for creative solutions. Templates didn’t have the intended outcome we hoped for, therefore we’re looking for alternatives

If it shows the templates are not working I'm all up for it as well! Would a "gamified" workflow tutorial work, getting points in the tutorial for each step completed on automation, sending out email, changing/copying values.
Not sure if understanding concepts, as "Don't try to put everything in 1 workflow and create a monster" would be a good one.
That’s an idea, yeah. At this point we’re gathering as many out of the box ideas as we can get before attempting to build a few prototypes.

The two  starting points for us are:
• “game” style tutorial like Code Academy: introduce the tool in a sandboxed environment, have the user run through linear “gameplay” to get a sense of the most basic tools, then move on to more complex interactions
• documentation style: add far more technical documentation: this one will likely be the outcome of a Debugger tool we’re considering at the moment, so we may get it for free anyways

The only thing I am missing sometimes, and this might give some more insights into this as well, is when I need to explain a workflow, with just the workflow view. I've started using comments as this. But If we can have a easier way to explain parts of workflows, inside the view, that might benefit new users as well.

Ok - I think your conclusion of API rate-limiting is accurate.  This is because the code-action is a scaled service and it processes multiple requests using Lambda services and when the workflow scales up, your API request limit per / 10 seconds is reached.

The good news is that it will retry based on the "Event" details but will retry for up to 3-days.

The work around to leverage Zapier could work but introduces another layer / costs that you'll have to evaluate.

My suggestion is to run the code externally once and get the data you need for the deals you have in the system and then enable the workflow to be triggered on events moving forward.

I'm going to think on a way to leverage dynamic lists to help with bulk enrollment and maybe there is a way to create a "queue"-like system within HubSpot that mirrors the Zapier solution.

I’ve gone through the same thing and I did a branch.. and added a delay to each branch before it hit the CCA.. it helped with 40k records enrolled, so like 5 branches, wait 5 mins increments (branch 1, no delay, branch 2, 5 mins delay, branch 3, 10 mins delay etc). And since every private api key has it’s own rate limit, I had multiple steps hitting HubSpot API, I created two and seperated what they had access to. One CCA used one private app, and then next one used another. This lowered the number of retries, it’s bulky but offers a kind of queue too.
Happy to hop on a call if this is unclear though.. but maybe it’ll work for this.
